idea: The company has invented a plant and machinery, which is developed based on a technology by IIP researchers, it can convert any of plastic(1 ton) waste into 800 litres of diesel. The fuel will be of automotive-grade. It meets the specifications for use in vehicles.  Using technology, polyolefinic waste can be converted into diesel. The process is also environmentally friendly. Also, its very low in sulphur content and, hence, less pollution.
name: JD Petroinfra

name: FLUIDAI PRIVATE LIMITED

idea:
We are planning to set up an manufacturing plant to make Nitrile gloves In India which can be used in Medical , Automobile, Engineering , Food , laboratories, industrial sectors Etc .


The product is made from Synthetic rubber . These Gloves will have superior chemical resistance to other disposable gloves due to the fact that Nitrile Rubber has better resistance to chemicals, acids & oils over against natural rubber. Nitrile Gloves are also powder free, these further reduces the risk of allergens and dealing with messy powders . Nitrile Exam Gloves have emerged as the preferred choice for the superior protection that they offer, sans the risk of allergy or dermatitis which is often the problem in using Latex gloves for examination


As per our Survey there is no company manufacturing these gloves in India . The current consumption is catered by importing these gloves from Malaysia majorly.  We had surveyed that during the pandemic COVID-19 situation the gloves were in short supply from these countries which led to the over pricing of these products by the overseas manufacturers and traders . the setup will definitely ensure that the cost would be consistently under control and the country will always be ready to tackle such kind of medical contingency 


The Project will be creating employment opportunities for both skilled as well as non-skilled labours . 


We will be manufacturing products of international quality standards which will also create wealth with exports of these products and would provide platform where our indian company will be competing with the overseas players in terms of quality and pricing . 


we are looking forward to hear from you on this regard. 


Thanks

idea: With the increasing consumption of gadgets with latest technologies, discarding rate of electronic equipment is also increasing rapidly but whatever discarded, need not necessarily be an end of life only. There are chances that certain equipment and components still has useful life either without much of refurbishment or by repairing & upgrading and are good for redeployment at different consumer levels. It may not be out of place to mention that in spite of Indiaâ€™s dominance in technology sector, penetration level of computerisation is still in a single digit primarily because the cost of acquiring new electronic asset is not within the reach of every consumer.refurbishment and remarketing should be promoted as much as possible thereby lower and middle income group can also have an access to electronic equipment and computer literacy ratio to the total population may be enhanced at an affordable costs
name: Electronics Waste Recycling-IT

idea: There is a considerable demand of HSD for stationary equipment like generator,sets, earth moving equipment, heavy machineries used in construction sites, mobile towers, etc. and these may not have facility / resource to store HSD.
